title: Ticket #141: Tests should use "print scalar localtime" instead of system("time")
description:
A number of the tests written in perl want to print the current time and date. Many do this with the following code: 
system("date")

We should prefer the following: 

print scalar localtime

Advantages:

  • Slightly faster (no fork/exec)
  • Doesn't rely on "date" (portability to Windows)

Disadvantages:

  • Doesn't print the time zone.

If we really want the time zone, the code is a little bit more complex, but could be encapsulated in CondorTest.pm; perhaps CondorTest::timestamp().
remarks: Done. Won't come in till I merge the test cruft. All the test files, batch_test and all the test perl modules in condor_scripts were converted by script.
